casebody.data:
[345] BATTEN against FORD. Shreaves Island, as per contract, 1 June, 1804, $200 00 $36 00 It was objected, first, that this state of demand was too uncertain; but the court thought that this was a sufficient statement of a contract of sale. It was then contended that this was a contract for the sale of land, and therefore ought to be in writing, according to the statute; but the court overruled the objection, and

ON CERTIORARI.

State of demand “for a piece of meadow ground at, &c., as per contract,” sufficient.

The state of demand below was—

For a piece of marsh or meadow ground, on the island called

It then gave credit at the same time with three notes, in all, 164 40

Affirmed the judgment.
